title: Boris bus firm rescue plan moves a step closer
text:
There were celebrations at the factory gates after a deal to save troubled bus builder Wrightbus moved a step closer.

The Northern Ireland operation – famous for building the Routemaster London buses, dubbed the Boris bus – was placed into administration last month with the loss of 1,200 jobs.

Wrightbus – which built the Routemaster London buses, dubbed the Boris bus – was placed into administration last month

English industrialist Jo Bamford announced yesterday he had agreed a deal in principle to buy the factory and associated land from former business owner Jeff Wright.

There was jubilation among former workers at the gates of the Ballymena plant yesterday morning.

Steve McMaster, who has worked for Wrightbus for 42 years, described it as the best day in his time working for the firm.

But regional officer for the Unite union George Brash warned that while a deal has been agreed in principle, there remain ‘a few hurdles to get over’.
